maml:description.maml:para: Adds a group member.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds a group member.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes a site.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a deleted site collection.
The Remove-KshTenantDeletedSiteCollection cmdlet removes a deleted site collection. This cmdlet can be used only when connected to the SharePoint admin center.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the deleted site collection.
If specified, continue executing script immediately.
Specifies the deleted site collection.
If specified, continue executing script immediately.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $siteCollection = Get-KshTenantDeletedSiteCollection -SiteCollectionUrl 'https://example.sharepoint.com/sites/hub' PS C:\> Remove-KshTenantDeletedSiteCollection -Identity $siteCollection

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes a deleted site collection.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a site collection.
The Remove-KshTenantDeletedSiteCollection cmdlet removes a deleted site collection. This cmdlet can be used only when connected to the SharePoint admin center.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the site collection.
If specified, continue executing script immediately.
Specifies the site collection.
If specified, continue executing script immediately.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $siteCollection = Get-KshTenantSiteCollection -SiteCollectionUrl 'https://example.sharepoint.com/sites/hub' PS C:\> Remove-KshTenantDeletedSiteCollection -Identity $siteCollection

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes a site collection.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a theme.
The Remove-KshTenantTheme cmdlet removes a theme from the tenant. This cmdlet can be used only when connected to the SharePoint admin center.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the theme.
Specifies the theme.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $theme = Get-KshTenantTheme -ThemeName 'Custom Theme' PS C:\> Remove-KshTenantTheme -Identity $theme

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes a theme.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a user.
The Remove-KshUser cmdlet removes a user from the current site.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the user.
Specifies the user.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $user = Get-KshUser -Identity 'i:0#.f|membership|admin@example.onmicrosoft.com' PS C:\> Remove-KshUser -Identity $user

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes a user from the current site.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a view.
The Remove-KshView cmdlet removes a view from the specified list.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the view.
Specifies the view.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $list = Get-KshList -ListTitle 'Announcements' PS C:\> $view = Get-KshView -List $list -ViewId 'bae9f925-48d3-47f5-bb07-92927a82df7d' PS C:\> Remove-KshView -Identity $view

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes a view from the list.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a view column.
The Remove-KshViewColumn cmdlet removes a column from the specified view.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the view.
If specified, removes all columns.
Specifies the view.
Specifies the column.
Specifies the view.
Specifies the column name.
If specified, removes all columns.
Specifies the column.
Specifies the column name.
Specifies the view.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:> $list = Get-KshList -ListTitle 'Announcements' PS C:> $view = Get-KshView -List $list -ViewTitle 'My Items' PS C:> $column = Get-KshColumn -List $list -ColumnName 'Remarks' PS C:> Remove-KshViewColumn -View $view -Column $column

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes a view column.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:> $list = Get-KshList -ListTitle 'Announcements' PS C:> $view = Get-KshView -List $list -ViewTitle 'My Items' PS C:> Remove-KshViewColumn -View $view -All

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes all view columns.

maml:description.maml:para: Restore a file version.
The Restore-KshFileVersion cmdlet creates a new file version from the specified file version.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the file.
Specifies the file version.
Specifies the file.
Specifies the file version.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $file = Get-KshFile -FileUrl '/sites/japan/hr/Shared%20Documents/README.txt' PS C:\> $fileVersion = Get-KshFileVersion -File $file -FileVersionId 1 PS C:\> Restore-KshFileVersion -File $file -FileVersion $fileVersion

dev:remarks.maml:para: Restores a file version.

maml:description.maml:para: Restore a recycle bin item.
The Restore-KshRecycleBinItem cmdlet moves a recycle bin item to its original location.

maml:Description.maml:para: If specified, restores all recycle bin items.
Specifies the recycle bin item.
If specified, restores all recycle bin items.
Specifies the recycle bin item.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $recycleBinItem = Get-KshRecycleBinItem -ItemId '77566246-6e0d-4bc7-8360-689b8743265f' PS C:\> Restore-KshRecycleBinItem -Identity $recycleBinItem

dev:remarks.maml:para: Restores a recycle bin item.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Restore-KshRecycleBinItem -All

dev:remarks.maml:para: Restores all recycle bin items.

maml:description.maml:para: Restore a deleted site collection.
The Restore-KshTenantDeletedSiteCollection cmdlet marks an deleted site collection as active. This cmdlet can be used only when connected to the SharePoint admin center.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the deleted site collection.
If specified, continue executing script immediately.
Specifies the deleted site collection.
If specified, continue executing script immediately.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $siteCollection = Get-KshTenantDeletedSiteCollection -SiteCollectionUrl 'https://example.sharepoint.com/sites/hub' PS C:\> Restore-KshTenantDeletedSiteCollection -Identity $siteCollection

dev:remarks.maml:para: Restores a deleted site collection.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a new attachment file.
The Save-KshAttachmentFile cmdlet adds a new attachment file to the list item.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the list item.
Specifies the contents.
Specifies the file name.
If specified, returns the updated object.
Specifies the contents.
Specifies the file name.
Specifies the list item.
If specified, returns the updated object.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $list = Get-KshList -ListTitle 'Announcements' PS C:\> $listItem = Get-KshListItem -List $list -ItemId 1 PS C:\> $content = [System.IO.File]::OpenRead("C:\README.txt") PS C:\> $attachmentFile = Save-KshAttachmentFile -Content $content -FileName 'README.txt'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds a new attachment file.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a new file.
The Save-KshFile cmdlet adds a new file to the specified folder. Maximum file size is 2GB.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the contents.
Specifies the file name.
Specifies the folder.
If specified, overwrites the existing file.
If specified, returns the updated object.
Specifies the contents.
Specifies the file name.
Specifies the folder.
If specified, overwrites the existing file.
If specified, returns the updated object.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $folder = Get-KshFolder -FolderUrl '/sites/japan/hr/Shared%20Documents' PS C:\> $content = [System.IO.File]::OpenRead("C:\README.txt") PS C:\> Save-KshFile -Folder $folder -Content $content -FileName 'README.txt'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds a new file.

maml:description.maml:para: Selectes a site.
The Select-KshSite cmdlet changes the current site. In order to change the current site to a different site collections, invoke the Connect-KshSite cmdlet.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the site.
If specified, returns the updated object.
Specifies the site.
If specified, returns the updated object.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $site = Get-KshSite -SiteId 'd298e576-6985-4119-9796-050b9f371872' PS C:\> Select-KshSite -Identity $site

dev:remarks.maml:para: Selects the site.

maml:description.maml:para: Changes the group owner.
Get-KshGroupOwner cmdlet changes the user or group that is the owner of the group.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the group.
Specifies the user or group.
Specifies the group.
Specifies the user or group.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $group = Get-KshGroup -GroupName 'Blog Owners' PS C:\> $owner = Get-KshUser -UserName 'i:0#.f|membership|admin@example.onmicrosoft.com' PS C:\> Set-KshGroupOwner -Identity $group -Owner $owner

dev:remarks.maml:para: Changes the group owner.

maml:description.maml:para: Resets an approval result for a folder.
The Suspend-KshFolder cmdlet resets an approval result for the folder. The approval status to be 'Pending'.

Specifies the comment.
If specified, returns the updated object.

Specifies the folder.

command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $folder = Get-KshFolder -FolderUrl '/sites/japan/hr/Shared%20Documents/Templates' PS C:\> Suspend-KshFolder -Identity $folder

dev:remarks.maml:para: Resets an approval result for the folder.

maml:description.maml:para: Resets an approval result for the list item.
The Suspend-KshListItem cmdlet resets an approval result for the list item. The approval status to be 'Pending'.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the list item.
Specifies the comment.
If specified, returns the updated object.
Specifies the comment.
Specifies the list item.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Resets an approval result for the list item.

maml:description.maml:para: Checks if the site collection is SharePoint admin center.
The Test-KshTenantSiteCollection cmdlet returns a value indicating whether the current site collection is SharePoint admin center.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Test-KshTenantSiteCollection

dev:remarks.maml:para: Checks the current site collection.

maml:description.maml:para: Checks in a file.
The Unlock-KshFile cmdlet checks in a file or discards a check-out file.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the file.
Specifies the check-in type.
Specifies the comment.
If specified, returns the updated object.
Specifies the file.
If specified, returns the updated object.
If specified, discards changes.
Specifies the check-in type.
Specifies the comment.
Specifies the file.
If specified, returns the updated object.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $file = Get-KshFile -FolderUrl '/sites/japan/hr/Shared%20Documents/README.txt' PS C:\> Unlock-KshFile -Identity $file -Comment 'Changed e-mail address'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Checks in the file.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $file = Get-KshFile -FolderUrl '/sites/japan/hr/Shared%20Documents/README.txt' PS C:\> Unlock-KshFile -Identity $file -Undo

dev:remarks.maml:para: Discards the check-out file.

maml:description.maml:para: Unlocks a site collection.
The Unlock-KshTenantSiteCollection cmdlet sets lock state of a site collection to Unlock. This cmdlet can be used only when connected to the SharePoint admin center.

If specified, continue executing script immediately.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $siteCollection = Get-KshTenantSiteCollection -SiteCollectionUrl 'https://example.sharepoint.com/sites/hub' PS C:\> Unlock-KshTenantSiteCollection -Identity $siteCollection

dev:remarks.maml:para: Unlocks the site collection.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates a view.
The Update-KshView cmdlet updates properties of the view.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the view.
Specifies columns and functions that define totals shown in a view.
Specifies whether totals are shown in the view.
Specifies the content type ID.
Specifies whether the view is a default view.
Specifies whether the view is a paged view for the content type.
Specifies whether editors can modified the view.
Specifies the formats.
Specifies whether to hide the view from users.
Specifies the image URL.
Specifies whether to include root folder.
Specifies the JSLink URL.
Specifies the view XML.
Specifies the method.
Specifies whether the view is a default view for mobile.
Specifies whether the view is a mobile view.
Specifies the document template URL.
Specifies whether the view is a paged view.
If specified, returns the updated object.
Specifies the number of items.
Specifies the scope.
Specifies whether the view is a tabular view.
Specifies the title.
Specifies the toolbar.
Specifies the view data.
Specifies the view joins XML.
Specifies the view projected columns XML.
Specifies the view query XML.
Specifies the view visualization info.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $list = Get-KshList -ListTitle 'Announcements' PS C:\> $view = Get-KshView -List $list -ViewId 'bae9f925-48d3-47f5-bb07-92927a82df7d' PS C:\> Update-KshView -Identity $view -DefaultView $true

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates property values of the view.
